definition.@value: A coefficient μ(E) calculated as the natural log the ratio of incident vs. tranmitted x-ray intensity, divided by the thickness of the sample.(ChatGPT).

note.@value: https://dictionary.iucr.org/Absorption_coefficient is usually where I look for this sort of thing (PA)

definition.@value: A coefficient μ(E) inferred from the intensity of emitted fluorescence photons; the fluorescence yield (probability of emission) is proportional to the absorbed fraction of the incident photons. (ChatGPT).

note.@value: Fluorescence is preferred for dilute samples (trace element studies, biological samples, catalysts, geological samples), because the emitted fluorescence is element-specific.

definition.@value: The measured X-ray flux transmitted through a sample (ChatGPT)
The measured X-ray flux hitting the sample at each monochromator energy setting. (ChatGPT)

note.@value: Measured by an ionization chamber (gas-filled detector) or photodiode placed before the sample.

definition.@value: The photon energy selected by the X-ray monochromator and delivered to the sample during an absorption scan.(ChatGPT)

note.@value: This is the independent variable in an XAS scan. NEXUS comment is 'energy selected'
NEXUS comment is 'energy standard deviation'.  1 sigma, 2 sigma?

definition.@value: The measured count rate or photon flux emitted by a sample following absorption of incident X-rays. (ChatGPT)

note.@value: measures the total amount of light (photons) emitted by a fluorophore after it absorbs energy from excitation light.

beamline property. From XDI dictionary 'A concise statement of how beam collimation is provided' . A collimated beam of electromagnetic radiation has parallel rays, and therefore will spread minimally as it propagates. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collimated_beam)

definition.@value: 'spacing between crystal planes of the reflection' (NEXUS ontology)

note.@value: monochromator crystal property. 'the spacing between atomic planes within the crystal. By satisfying Bragg's Law (nλ = 2d sinθ), the monochromator selects a desired wavelength (λ) of radiation from an incident beam, where 'd' is the atomic plane spacing and 'θ' is the Bragg angle.'(Google AI overview)

definition.@value: Miller indices (hkl) values of nominal reflection (NEXUS ontology)

note.@value: monochromator crystal property

definition.@value: Type or material of monochromating substance. (NEXUS)

note.@value: monochromator crystal property; values reported in NEXUS as of 2010-11-17  {PG (Highly Oriented Pyrolytic Graphite) | Ge | Si | Cu | Fe3Si | CoFe | Cu2MnAl (Heusler) | Multilayer | Diamond.}

definition.@value: The chemical formula [of the monochromator material] specified using [Crystallographic Information File] CIF conventions. (NEXUS)

note.@value: monochromator crystal property. NOTE-- seems redundant with NXcrystal/type.  CIF conventions at https://www.iucr.org/resources/cif/spec/version1.1

definition.@value: The absorption edge as used in the data acquisition software.(XDI dictionary)

note.@value: Discussed in team meeting 2025-09-08; general sense in group is that this is a known quantity specified for experiment design, not a measured result.

definition.@value: The energy of the stored current in the storage ring. (XDI)

note.@value: in XDI this is a property of the Facility, so include 'facility' prefix

definition.@value: description of how the [photon] flux was measured (XDI)

note.@value: property of detector, see https://github.com/XraySpectroscopy/XAS-Data-Interchange/blob/master/specification/dictionary.md#defined-items-in-the-detector-namespace, tags for i0, it, if, ir

definition.@value: A concise statement about how beam focusing is provided. (XDI)
A concise statement about how harmonic rejection is accomplished.(XDI)

note.@value: X-ray absorption harmonic rejection is the process of eliminating unwanted higher-energy X-ray harmonics from a beam (Google AI overview)

definition.@value: The fraction of the sample volume that is empty space

note.@value: material property of sample.  Expressed as a fraction between 0 and 1, or as a percentage between 0% and 100%.
Environmental condition of sample during analysis. Need some clarification on exactly what pressure is applied--is the sample in an anvil?  a leak proof tank with pressurized fluid?

definition.@value: type of radiation source (NEXUS)

note.@value: one of {'Spallation Neutron Source' , 'Pulsed Reactor Neutron Source' , 'Reactor Neutron Source' , 'Synchrotron X-ray Source' , 'Pulsed Muon Source' , 'Rotating Anode X-ray' , 'Fixed Tube X-ray' , 'UV Laser' , 'Free-Electron Laser' , 'Optical Laser' , 'Ion Source' , 'UV Plasma Source' , 'Metal Jet X-ray'}  (NEXUS ontology)

definition.@value: Detection method used for observing the sample absorption. (NEXUS)

note.@value: property of experiment; controlled list of process being monitored to obtain the spectrum.  One of {'Total Electron Yield' , 'Partial Electron Yield' , 'Auger Electron Yield' , 'Fluorescence Yield' , 'Transmission'}

definition.@value: Element that is the target for observing an x-ray absorption edge.

note.@value: Element being analyzed. Need element vocabulary, e.g. http://sweetontology.net/matrElement/Iron

definition.@value: Target absorption edge.

note.@value: The 'edge' is a sudden increase in x-ray absorption occurring when the energy of incident X-rays is just above the binding energy of the targeted electron shell of the atoms interacting with the photons. vocabulary from XDI spec: {K, L, L1, L2, L3, M, M1, M2, M3, M4, M5, N, N1, N2, N3, N4, N5, N6, N7, O, O1, O2, O3, O4, O5, O6, O7}

definition.@value: algorithm for aggregating data in detectors measuring excitation and sample response

note.@value: Count to a preset value based on either clock time (timer) or received monitor counts (monitor).

definition.@value: configuration of monitor mode

note.@value: either counting time or preset count value.

definition.@value: Kind of detector used to measure photon fluxes.

note.@value: detector.i0, .it, .if, .ir – descriptions of how fluxes were measured. NEXUS examples:  He3 gas cylinder, He3 PSD, scintillator, fission chamber, proportion counter, ion chamber, ccd, pixel, image plate, CMOS.  Allow different detector types for incident, transmitted, ....?

definition.@value: the method of sample preparation. (XDI)
chemical formula for sample material

note.@value: as with Monochromator, use CIF conventions. Note: 'Stoichiometry is the relationships between the quantities of reactants and products before, during, and following chemical reactions.'(Wikipedia).  Not sure that's the label we want for this property...

definition.@value: length of sample material in the direction of incident x-rays

note.@value: is thickness measured in any particular direction (e.g. in the direction of incident x-rays)?

definition.@value: mass of the sample

note.@value: Point groups describe the symmetry of a point without translations, always leaving at least one point fixed; space groups  describe the symmetry of a crystal lattice allowing translations. In three dimensions,  there are 32 crystallographic point groups, and 230 unique space groups (ChatGPT) . Various notation systems are used to classify these groups (Wikipedia). ? is there a preferred system in XAS?

definition.@value: [Crystallographic] Unit cell parameters (lengths and angles) (NEXUS)

note.@value: 'unit cell is a region that just fills space without any overlapping when translated through some subset of the vectors of a Bravais lattice.' (Ashcroft, Neil W. (1976). 'Chapter 4'. Solid State Physics. W. B. Saunders Company. p. 73)

definition.@value: Kind of substance that constitutes the sample.

note.@value: Material type encompasses state of matter. E.g. See iSamples material type vocabulary (https://vocabs.ardc.edu.au/viewById/664).

definition.@value: identifier for a material sample from which the analyzed sample was derived

note.@value: Note-- Analysis has broad connotations; would 'Measurement Event' be better, to distinguish from 'Analysis' as scientific activity to interpret data? YES!!!!! (AG)

definition.@value: Instrument component in an x-ray facility that delivers a precisely controlled x-ray beam from the storage ring to the experimental station where the sample is placed.
a device for detecting the presence of electromagnetic waves (Merriam-Webster)

note.@value: NEXUS has 'A detector, detector bank, or multidetector.' which is not a definition.

definition.@value: [A place] that is built, installed, or established to serve a particular purpose (Merriam-Webster)

note.@value: a place that hosts instruments and other necessary components to support XAS research.  NEXUS comment is 'The neutron or x-ray storage ring/facility'

definition.@value: a measuring device for determining the present value of a quantity under observation (Merriam-Webster 3a)

note.@value: NXInstrument has 'Collection of the components of the instrument or beamline'. Not really a definition.  Does make clear that an instrument has parts.

definition.@value: [A device that]  selects a wavelength or energy (from NEXUS)

note.@value: A device for isolating a narrow portion of a spectrum (Merriam-Webster).  A device that transmits a selectable narrow band of wavelengths of light or other radiation chosen from a wider range of wavelengths available at the input. [Wikipedia]

definition.@value: A device that generates X-rays.
